creator: dcanofr@gmail.com
text:
I have a problem with tomcat. I tried it with tomcat 4 and tomcat 5.

Some users have something wrong in their connections. The problem is that they
request a page, and tomcat response blocks on the write operation. I think, the
problem is the socket write. Finally this users could take all available
connections. The users free the connections after a looooooong time, so tomcat
works without many threads that are blocked.

I supose the problem is that java doesn't support the write timeout in sockets.
To reproduce the problem is very easy. Build a program with a socket that
request a big page and don't close it and don't read the response. Then you will
see in the tomcat manager that the thread is blocked in the send stage.

This is a problem if you have a big site and if someone want to do a DoS attack,
this is a very easy way. One computer even with a slow connection can make this
attack.

Is there a way to avoid this? May be apache server could work better with this
situation?

Thanks in advance.

creator: markt@apache.org
text:
A Google search for "slow client connection DOS" provides lots if interesting
reading including some discussions on httpd functionality.

For now I am closing this as INVALID as there isn't an actual Tomcat bug or
request for a specific new feature in this report. I would suggest that the
users list is the best place to discuss options for handling this particular
problem. If the result of that discussion is "If only there was an option in
Tomcat that enabled admins to..." then please re-open this issue as an
enhancement request and document the requirement. As ever in open source,
enhancement requests are more likely to be implemented if accompanied by a
tested patch.
